intro: Trichonema ramosum, commonly known as the branching moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth form and is typically found in moist, shaded environments. The plant has short, dense stems with closely spaced leaves that are often curved or twisted. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on short, erect stalks and release spores when mature. Trichonema ramosum is often used in ecological studies due to its sensitivity to environmental changes.
